FacilityName: City of Monett Wastewater Treatment Facility

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Monett WWTF is a municipaly owned 4 MGD wastewater treatment facility.
The effluent from this facility is chlorinated and dechlorinated prior to discharge. 
Maximum chlorine and sulfur dioxide stored are 6000# each.
 
This facility has had no reportable incidents since placed on line in 1978. 

The risk posed by this facility to the community is possible exposure to chlorine or sulfur dioxide gas in the event of an accidental release caused by damaged cylinder or feed line.

RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM
  PERSONNEL:
Operators at this facility are trained in the proper operation and handling of these chemicals and equipment.
The city has contracted MESO Co. to hold regular safety classes for all personnel.
The city has an in house safety council to discuss and remedy any safety concerns for all departments.
Wastewater personnel are required to have 30 hours of refresher training every three years, of which Chlorine safety is included.
Wastewater personnel are State of Missouri licensed operators.
Wastewater personnel have been through cylinder repair, SCBA, First aid and CPR classes.
Wastewater personnel are required to read, understand and follow ERP and SOP.

  EQUIPMENT:
All chlorination and dechlorination equipment has been specified and supplied by qulified engineers and manufacturers.
Equipment is current technology and updated as needed.
Leak detection and warning devices are tested regularly.
Equipment is on a regular maintenance schedule.

  S.O.P:
Standard operating procedures are in a writtin format that is easy to read and follow.
Procedures dictate how to perform each task in a safe manner.
Damaged, leaking or suspicious containers are not accepted.
Process chemicals are regularly weighed and recorded.
Process equipment is regularly checked for condition and operation.
All needed repairs are remedied ASAP.

  EMERGENCY RESPONSE:
The city police, fire and utility departments currently work with the ambulance district, hospital and area LEPC on disaster pre

peredness.
The Fire/Hazmat departments have A Level trained personnel to respond to emergency situations.

UPDATE:
The city's water department storage facility has been removed and its inventory is now stored at WWTF to decrease the number of storage sites to one.
